pullrequest.title: Merge forward from ign-tools0 and bump to 1.0.0

content.raw:
If we want to have a single command \(\`ign\`\) that can work as a wrapper to call a given version of ign-tools then we have different options:

1. Add the logic to do this in the ign command \(modify the code in this repo\)
2. Leave the code as it is now and drop the responsibility of handling different versions under the same command to the packaging system:

    1. Ubuntu/Debian uses `update-alternatives`
    2. Don’t know how brew or windows will handle this.
    

In the short term we can make the packages to conflict and do not support side-by-side installations if it is not a critical use case.

If we want to have a single command (`ign`) that can work as a wrapper to call a given version of ign-tools then we have different options:

  1. Add the logic to do this in the ign command (modify the code in this repo)

  2. Leave the code as it is now and drop the responsibility of handling different versions under the same command to the packaging system:

    1. Ubuntu/Debian uses update-alternatives
    2. Don’t know how brew or windows will handle this.

In the short term we can make the packages to conflict and do not support side-by-side installations if it is not a critical use case.
